description: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada has a requirement for two 9.5 - 10.5m Glass Reinforced Plastic (GRP) Cabin Boats and trailers built in accordance with the Technical Statement of Requirement at Annex A.
full_summary:
================
### Tender Announcement: 9.5-10.5m GRP Cabin Vessels

**Reference Number**: PW___MC_038_29198

**Tender Closing Date**: November 24, 2023, at 2:00 PM EST

**Tender Description**
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada is soliciting bids for the procurement of two 9.5-10.5m Glass Reinforced Plastic (GRP) Cabin Vessels and trailers, as per the Technical Statement of Requirement at Annex A. The delivered products must meet all Mandatory Requirements of the Request for Proposal.

**Key Requirements**

* Deliverables must be delivered to Cap Aux Meules, Quebec, and Grand Riviere, Quebec within 14 months after contract award.
* The requirement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).
* There is no security associated with this requirement.

**Pricing and Evaluation Criteria**
The selection criteria for this tender are as follows:
* Lowest/Lower Bid

**Language of Tendering**
The tender documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.

**Attachments**
Complete tender documents, including the Technical Statement of Requirement, can be downloaded from the Canada Government eBuy portal.

**Contact Information**
For additional information or to request tender documents, please contact:
Vicki Robson
vicki.robson@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
(613) 286-4376

...

Now I replace the text between the three dots with the existing english text from the original entry to include it in the output...

... with the Tenders Description of the original text:
 
The Department of Fisheries and Oceans Canada has a requirement for two 9.5 - 10.5m Glass Reinforced Plastic (GRP) Cabin Boats and trailers built in accordance with the Technical Statement of Requirement at Annex A.

All deliverables must be delivered to Cap Aux Meules, Quebec and Grand Riviere, Quebec no later than 14months after contract award.

To be considered compliant, Bidders must meet all the Mandatory Requirements of the Request for Proposal.

This requirement is subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA).

There is no security associated with this requirement.

Delivery Date: Above-mentioned

The Crown retains the right to negotiate with suppliers on any procurement.

Documents may be submitted in either official language of Canada.
